intro: Eriogonum heermannii var. subracemosum, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh conditions. The species is known for its ability to bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a subtle floral display to its native habitat.
